results.title: Your friend the soil: keep it - or lose it
results.brief_description: Partly animated and partly live action, this film shows how the nation’s food production depends on good farming practices such as contour ploughing and strip cropping, resulting in abundant crops, healthy farm animals and therefore, well-stocked shops. Discusses soil erosion and bad farming techniques. Suitable for primary level.

Discusses soil erosion and bad farming techniques. Suitable for primary level.

results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, Hindle Marriott Edgar and Kenneth Carter

results.title: Your credit is good
results.brief_description: The film opens with a sequence of artwork describing how instalment buying works. Then the message is driven home that no matter what you think, you’ve been promised verbally, no matter how good or easy it sounds - you pay what it says on the paper.

results.title: Your clothing can burn
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Alfred Higgins
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the correct as well as incorrect procedures for dealing with clothing whenit is ignited. Uses laboratory experiments to show the importance of selecting clothing and fabrics that resist fire.

results.title: Your choice
results.brief_description: Raoul, an alligator, has a bad tooth and also needs a hair cut. Is he going to the barber or to the dentist, or neither of them? Madillo, an armadillo, wonders if he should bring an umbrella or not. So, what is your choice?

results.title: Your children walking
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Brian Smith and Alex Strasser
results.brief_description: Stresses the importance of adopting good foot habits and wearing suitable shoes and socks in childhood to develop strong, healthy feet. Studies the physiology of the foot.

results.title: Your children and you
results.creator_credit: British Ministry of Health and Brian Smith
results.brief_description: Child care in the first years of life. Many hints on the correct care of infants and young children are given, from the weaning of the infant to the prevention of unnecessary fears, boredom, bad temper and maladjustment.

results.title: Your children's teeth
results.creator_credit: C O I, Realist Films, Margaret Thomson and Jane Massy
results.brief_description: The structure of the teeth, tooth formation and the process of decay are explained by means of diagrams. The importance of pre-natal care and of proper diet, cleaning habits and regular inspections are also shown
